Summary: The patient's chief complaint was extreme fatigue, occasional dizziness on rising, and severe constipation. Her medical history includes childhood radioactive iodine exposure, osteoporosis, and synthetic T3 treatment. The patient was treated with nutritional supplements and intravenous infusions. Although there was improvement in her laboratory tests, deterioration still occurred. The patient's discharge condition showed significant improvement in her laboratory results. No medication changes were made during the hospital course. The patient was advised to continue with her current treatment
